title: Nicki Minaj Praises Trump, Calls JD Vance An ‘Assassin’ To Charlie Kirk’s Widow | 10 News
description: Rapper Nicki Minaj has made a surprise appearance at a Turning Point USA convention in Arizona, using her time on stage to praise President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance.  Minaj was interviewed by Erika Kirk, the widow of Charlie Kirk, about her newly found support for Trump despite condemning him in the past.  There was an unfortunate awkward moment when the star praised “the assassin JD Vance,” leading to a few seconds of silence and laughter from the audience, with Kirk’s husband Charlie having been fatally shot in September.  "Dear young men, you have amazing role models like our handsome, dashing president, and you have amazing role models like the assassin, JD Vance, our vice president," Minaj said before looking down and covering her mouth. title: Netanyahu Honours Bondi Victims In Jerusalem Chabad Hanukkah Ceremony | 10 News
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has commemorated victims of the Bondi Beach Shooting with Chabad emissaries on Sunday to light the last candle of Hanukkah in Jerusalem.  Netanyahu said the attack during a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney last week, where 15 people were killed and dozens wounded, will not break the spirit of the Jewish people.  “But I say from the depth of our hearts we share in the grief, but we also see the greatness, and we are more determined than ever to ensure the eternity of Israel,” Netanyahu said. title: LIVE: NSW Premier Chris Minns To Address New Laws Following Bondi Beach Shooting | 10 News
description: NSW Premier Chris Minns is addressing the media after he recalled parliament to introduce new laws that would tighten gun control, deal with hate speech and give police new powers when dealing with protestors.

title: Nine Killed & 10 Injured After Mass Shooting At South African Pub | 10 News
description: Nine people have died and at least 10 others wounded after a group of gunmen carried out a shooting at a South African pub during the early hours of Sunday.  Police say around 12 unknown suspects in a white mini-bus and a silver sedan opened fire at patrons at KwaNoxolo tavern in Johannesburg's Bekkersdal township just before 1am and continued to shoot randomly as they fled the scene.  It is the second mass shooting to happen in South Africa in three weeks, after gunmen killed a dozen people, including a three-year-old child, at a tavern near Pretoria on December 6. title: New Details As Full Case Against Bondi Beach Gunman Is Revealed | 10 News
description: For the first time tonight, we can reveal the full police case against the father and son accused of carrying out the Bondi massacre.   Police allege the pair "meticulously planned" the terror attack, undertaking firearms training in what is believed to be country New South Wales.   They're also accused of making pipe bombs, filming an ISIS inspired video and scoping out the area where they're accused of launching their deadly attack - two days before it happened. title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Unveils New Laws Targeting Hate Speech & Radicalisation | 10 News
description: The federal opposition has launched a blistering rebuke of the Prime Minister as he continues to resist calls for a Royal Commission.   The PM today throwing his support behind a New South Wales state-based probe but insists a commonwealth commission would take too long. title: National Vigils Take Place to Honour Bondi Beach Terror Attack Victims | 10 News
description: There were tense scenes as thousands gathered at memorials around the country last night, to honour the Bondi victims - exactly one week after the terrorist attack.  At a community vigil in Bondi - The Prime Minister was booed, a man was 'moved on' after trying to rush at him, while the New South Wales Premier was given a standing ovation.  But the overwhelming message - this is a time for unity. title: Chris Minns Government Pushes for Tough Gun Laws to Be Passed Before Christmas | 10 News
description: New South Wales could be home to the toughest gun laws in Australia before Christmas if new reforms are fast-tracked through parliament.   The proposed Bill, which has bundled together protest, terrorist symbol and gun reforms is still being debated and despite some criticism is expected to pass the lower house later tonight. title: Russian General Killed In Moscow Car Bomb As Ukraine War Ceasefire Talks Stall | 10 News
description: A senior Russian general has been killed after a car bomb exploded in a residential district of southern Moscow, heightening tensions amid stalled peace efforts.  Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov, head of the Russian General Staff’s training department, died when an explosive device detonated beneath his parked SUV.  Investigators say the attack bears the hallmarks of previous assassinations linked to Ukraine, though Kyiv has not commented on the blast.  The killing comes as Moscow reports slow progress in US-brokered ceasefire talks aimed at ending the nearly four-year war in Ukraine. title: Venezuela Accuses US Of Piracy After Oil Tanker Seizures & Naval Blockade | 10 News
description: Venezuela has described the US seizure of two oil tankers off its coast as "piracy" after the Trump administration intercepted multiple vessels in international waters.  Venezuela Foreign Minister Yvan Gil read a letter from President Nicolas Maduro addressed to Latin American and Caribbean leaders and United Nations member states, warning of an escalation of US aggression  In the statement, Venezuela reaffirmed its commitment to peace and urged the international community to condemn these acts and defend international law.  The move follows days after US President Donald Trump announced a “blockade” of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela. title: Sinkhole Traps Boats In Shropshire Canal | 10 News
description: A massive sinkhole has opened in a canal in England’s Shropshire county, trapping two boats in deep mud and damaging a third.  Emergency services declared a major incident after a significant breach of the Shropshire Union Canal in Whitchurch.  More than 10 people were rescued as crews worked through unstable ground and rapidly moving water, with no injuries reported.  The affected section of the canal has been dammed off while investigators work to determine the cause of the collapse. title: Trump Says US Needs Greenland For National Security | 10 News
description: President Donald Trump has renewed calls to take over Greenland, stating the United States needs to have the country, not for critical minerals but for “national security”.  It follows Trump naming Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry as his special envoy to the self-governing Danish territory on Sunday, sparking new tensions between the nation’s leaders.  Denmark’s Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen stating, “I am very upset about this appointment of a special envoy. And I am particularly upset about the envoy's statements, which we find completely unacceptable."
